intro: Antirhea madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar antirhea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and large, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Antirhea madagascariensis is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
